intro: Lasiandra oleifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant has a dense, woody structure with dark green, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lasiandra oleifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
